Entries.default: "Merla. Ezzali is sharper than she lets on if she knew we were coming."
"We won't get far while Vilami is on our tail!"
"I'll see myself out. Better get back to Martino."
"Good work. That old veteran put up a spirited fight." Belda greets you with a weary grin, clutching a wound in her side.
"You need a hand?"
"Ezzali's dead, by the way."
"Good, because I'm not carrying you."
"Let's go, then."
"Backup plan! No witnesses!"
"Surrender now and I offer you mercy. I make no promises that I'll follow through." Vilami grins.
"Lay down your arms, thief. The odds are in our favor."
"There's no need for you to die today."
"You will live again. Try to make fewer mistakes next time around."
[Attack] "We didn't come to parley, Vilami! Kill them!"
"If you don't mind, I'm not finished deriving a little joy out of this life."
"I'd be intrigued if I thought for a second that Ezzali means to spare me."
She squeezes off a shot at Captain Vilami. The bullet catches him in the arm, and he reels away with a pained cry.
"For your lives, boys! At them!" Belda raises her pistol and readies to fire.
"The odds can turn when you're distracted by too much talk." Belda winks and raises her pistol.

"Merla. Di verus? I was just here to rob her.

"Then again, I guess you're not so worried about the guards." 

She nods at the corpses around you.
"Now you're hunting for my last nerve. Just don't lock it behind you, bazzo."
Entries.female: "Now you're hunting for my last nerve. Just don't lock it behind you, right?"

Entries.default: "Ah, it's touching that you care. Just... leave the window open. I'll see myself out."
"After you." Belda rises to her feet, wincing.

"You head up those stairs and her people will cut you down. I suggest you head out the way I came, out the window in the room down that way.

"I can take care of myself. Just need a rest."

"This... aheh, didn't go exactly as planned, did it?

"If Ezzali didn't know you were crossing her, I'll bet she's figuring it out in a hurry."
"Vilami, look out!"

Captain Vilami deftly steps aside as Belda squeezes off a shot from her pistol. The bullet misses its target by a wide margin. 

Vilami nods to you with gratitude.

"Merla again. Any chance of resuming negotiations? Thought not."

She cocks her pistol and signals to the other thieves.
"We'll return what we don't end up using. Just so there's no hard feelings."
"If we're going to be in the habit of helping criminals, I'm glad this lot is more polite than the Doemenels."
"I have had enough of this stupid feud. I can only hope this brings an end to the nonsense."
"If we are robbing Vailians to aid Vailians, what do we achieve here then?"
"This ought to be fun. I've been meaning to teach Ishi how to crack a safe."

"We really doing this, helping a thief? Now, don't look at me like that. I just had to ask."

Xoti tosses her hands up in defeat.
"You know we be entitled to ninety percent of every cocked-up heist we set aright, aye? Deadfire's Third Law, it is."
The burglar slowly brings her hand closer to a weapon.
"I'm relieved we haven't lost sight of the important work before us."
"I'm not leaving until I check out that vault."

"You're mad, hanging around here with Vilami's blood is still on your boots. 

"No wonder Martino sent you."
"Anything you can get away with, right?"
